page.title: 09Council Workers
page.content: Council Worker. I get up at 6.30 AM have a cup of coffee but no breakfast and cycle to Holmes Chapel, that is 5 miles. We travel from Holmes Chapel by motor lorry to our work. We start at 8.00 AM. I work for Cheshire County Council doing road repairs chiefly. I lay kerbs and footpaths, and lay tar all day. We have half an hour for lunch. We finish work at 4.30 PM. On Fridays we finish early at 3.30 PM. We work 39 hours a week. In the winter time we are on call. That means we could be called out to grit the roads in frosty weather. In the evenings I work in my garden growing vegetable and flowers. Sometimes I help out at a local farm.
